00022 /**
00023  * @file   SparseMart.cpp
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Fri Oct 21 17:38:28 2005
00026  *
00027  * @brief Class for representing cel file intensity data in memory.
00028  * Can save a lot of the space if not all of a cel file needs to be
00029  * remembered for downstream analysis.
00030  */
00031 
00032 //
00033 #include "chipstream/SparseMart.h"
00034 //
00035 #include "util/Util.h"

00037 using namespace std;
00038 /**
00039  * @brief Constructor that takes a boolean mask indicating which
00040  * probes will be needed for downstream analysis.
00041  * @param probes - Bitmask where 'true' indicates probe will be
00042  * needed and 'false' indicates it can be discarded.
00043  */
00044 SparseMart::SparseMart(std::vector<bool> &probes) {
00045     unsigned int i = 0;
00046     unsigned int count = 0;
00047     m_AnalysisOrder.reserve(probes.size());
00048     for (i = 0; i < probes.size(); i++) {
00049         if (probes[i] == true) {
00050             m_AnalysisOrder.push_back(i);
00051             count++;
00052         }
00053     }
00054     m_ProbeSize = count;
00055     m_MaxProbeSize = 0;
00056     m_NumChips = 0;
00057     m_MaxNumChips = 0;
00058     m_UniqueAnalysisOrderSize = 0;
00059 }
00060 
00061 /** 
00062  * @brief Constructor that takes a vector indicating an ordering of probe ids
00063  * @param order - vector of probe ids.  Postition in vector indicates ordering.
00064  */
00065 SparseMart::SparseMart(const std::vector<probeidx_t> &analysisOrder, 
00066                        const std::vector<std::string>& celNames, 
00067                        bool storeAllCelIntensities) {
00068     m_AnalysisOrder = analysisOrder;
00069     m_FileNames = celNames;
00070     m_StoreAllCelIntensities = storeAllCelIntensities;
00071     m_MaxProbeSize = 0;
00072     m_NumChips = 0;
00073     m_ProbeSize = 0;
00074     m_MaxNumChips = 0;
00075     m_UniqueAnalysisOrderSize = 0;
00076 }
00077 
00078 
00079 /**
00080  * Constructor that assumes all probes will be loaded, not so sparse
00081  * I guess.
00082  * @param size - number of probes on array.
00083  */
00084 SparseMart::SparseMart(unsigned int size) {
00085     m_Map.reserve(size);
00086     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00087         m_Map.push_back(i);
00088     }
00089     m_ProbeSize = size;
00090     m_MaxProbeSize = 0;
00091     m_NumChips = 0;
00092     m_MaxNumChips = 0;
00093     m_UniqueAnalysisOrderSize = 0;
00094 }

00098 /**
00099  * @brief Method to create empty sparseMart with same parameters.
00100  */
00101 SparseMart* SparseMart::copyMetaDataToEmptyMart() const {
00102 
00103     SparseMart* newMart = new SparseMart(m_AnalysisOrder, 
00104                                          m_FileNames, 
00105                                          m_StoreAllCelIntensities);
00106     newMart->m_Order = m_Order;
00107     newMart->m_Map = m_Map;
00108     newMart->m_UniqueAnalysisOrderSize = m_UniqueAnalysisOrderSize;
00109     newMart->m_ChipChannelToCacheMap = m_ChipChannelToCacheMap;
00110     return newMart;
00111 }

00115  * identify and set datasets grouped by CEL file

00117 void SparseMart::setChannelMapping(const IdxGroup &idxGroup) {
00118     m_CelChannels = idxGroup;
00119     std::vector<std::vector<unsigned int> > TempChannelGroup = m_CelChannels.getGroupingVec("channels");
00120     setChipChannelMap(TempChannelGroup);
00121 }

00123 /**
00124  * @brief set object that will translate from chip,channel to cache index
00125  * @param chip_channel_map - First dimension is chipIx, second is
00126  * channelIx, value is cache index
00127  */
00128 void SparseMart::setChipChannelMap(std::vector<std::vector<unsigned int> >& chipChannelMap) {
00129     m_ChipChannelToCacheMap = chipChannelMap;
00130 }

00132 /** 
00133  * @brief Given a vector of data use it to fill in all of the datapoints
00134  * that are going to be needed.
00135  *
00136  * @param dataName - Name of the vector of data (usually the cel filename).
00137  * @param data - cel file intensity data.
00138  */
00139 void SparseMart::setProbeIntensity(const int dataIdx, 
00140                                    const std::vector<float> &data) {
00141     unsigned int i = 0;
00142     int probeCount = data.size();
00143     assert(probeCount > 0);
00144     if (m_Map.size() == 0) {
00145         // initialize map and prune AnalysisOrder of duplicate ids
00146         m_Order.reserve(probeCount);
00147         m_Map.resize(probeCount);
00148 
00149         fill(m_Map.begin(), m_Map.end(), -1);
00150         fill(m_Order.begin(), m_Order.end(), -1);
00151 
00152         int indexCount = 0;
00153         for (i = 0; i < m_AnalysisOrder.size(); i++) {
00154             int probeIndex = m_AnalysisOrder[i]; 
00155             if (m_Map[probeIndex] == -1) {
00156                 m_Order.push_back(probeIndex);
00157                 m_Map[probeIndex] = indexCount++;
00158             }
00159         }
00160         // store the size of the analysis order after any duplicate probes
00161         // ids have been removed.
00162         m_UniqueAnalysisOrderSize = m_Order.size();
00163         if (m_StoreAllCelIntensities && probeCount > m_Order.size()) {
00164             // probe intensities that are not in m_AnalysisOrder are tacked
00165             // onto the end of m_Order.  in this way, m_AnalysisOrder probe
00166             // intensities will be cached efficiently, and yet
00167             // non-m_AnalysisOrder probe intensities will still be available
00168             // in the diskmart.
00169             for (i = 0; i < probeCount; i++) {
00170                 if (m_Map[i] == -1) {
00171                     m_Order.push_back(i);
00172                     m_Map[i] = indexCount++;
00173                 }
00174             }
00175         }
00176     }
00177 
00178     int write_data_size = data.size();
00179     if (!m_StoreAllCelIntensities &&
00180         write_data_size > m_UniqueAnalysisOrderSize) {
00181         write_data_size = m_UniqueAnalysisOrderSize;
00182     }
00183 
00184     if (dataIdx >= m_Data.size()) {
00185 //     Verbose::out(2, "SparseMart::setProbeIntensity() - Adding a chip, try reserve to be more memory efficient.");
00186         // Enlarge m_Data to accomodate new data
00187         m_Data.resize(dataIdx + 1);
00188     }
00189     if (m_Data[dataIdx].empty()) {
00190         // No data written for this dataIdx yet.  Resize accordingly
00191         m_Data[dataIdx].resize(write_data_size, 0.0);
00192         m_NumChips++;
00193     }
00194 
00195     for (int i = 0; i < write_data_size; i++) {
00196         if (m_Order[i] >=0) {
00197 //       assert(m_Order[i] < write_data_size);
00198             m_Data[dataIdx][i] = data[m_Order[i]];
00199         }
00200     }
00201 }
00202 /** 
00203  * @brief Given the probe index and chip index return the intensity
00204  * data appropriate for that probe in that chip. Depending on the
00205  * object that intensity may have been modified from the original
00206  * found on the chip.
00207  * 
00208  * @param probeIx - Probe Index number.
00209  * @param chipIx - Chip Index number.
00210  * @return float - intensity for that position on array.
00211  */
00212 float SparseMart::getProbeIntensity(probeid_t probeIx, 
00213                                     chipid_t chipIx, 
00214                                     unsigned int channelIx) const {
00215     assert(probeIx < m_Map.size() && probeIx >= 0);
00216     assert(m_Map[probeIx] >= 0);
00217   
00218     int dataSetIx;
00219     if (m_ChipChannelToCacheMap.empty()) {
00220         dataSetIx = chipIx;
00221     }
00222     else {
00223         dataSetIx = m_ChipChannelToCacheMap[chipIx][channelIx];
00224     }
00225     assert(dataSetIx < m_Data.size() && dataSetIx >= 0);
00226     return m_Data[dataSetIx][m_Map[probeIx]];
00227 }

00229 
00230 void SparseMart::clear() {
00231     unsigned int i = 0;
00232     m_ProbeSize = 0;
00233     m_NumChips = 0;
00234     fill(m_Map.begin(), m_Map.end(), -1);
00235     for (i = 0; i < m_Data.size(); i++) {
00236         fill(m_Data[i].begin(), m_Data[i].end(), 0.0f);
00237     }
00238 }
00239 
00240 void SparseMart::reserve(int numProbes, int numChips) {
00241     if (numProbes < m_ProbeSize) {
00242         Err::errAbort("SparseMart::reserve() - Have to reserve at least enough probes for current size: " + ToStr(m_ProbeSize));
00243     }
00244     m_MaxProbeSize = numProbes;
00245     m_MaxNumChips = numChips;
00246     m_Data.resize(m_MaxNumChips);
00247     m_FileNames.resize(m_MaxNumChips);
00248     Verbose::out(2, 
00249                  "Reserving with: " + ToStr(numChips) + " chips and " + 
00250                  ToStr(numProbes) + " probes.");
00251     for (int i = 0; i < numChips; i++) {
00252         m_Data[i].resize(m_MaxProbeSize);
00253         std::fill(m_Data[i].begin(), m_Data[i].end(), 0.0f);
00254     }
00255 }
00256 
00257 void SparseMart::setProbes(std::vector<bool> &probes) {
00258     unsigned int i = 0;
00259     unsigned int count = 0;
00260     m_Map.resize(probes.size());
00261     /* set up the map. */
00262     for (i = 0; i < probes.size(); i++) {
00263         if (probes[i] == true) {
00264             m_Map[i] = count++;
00265         } else {
00266             m_Map[i] = -1;
00267         }
00268     }
00269     m_ProbeSize = count;
00270     /* If there are more probes now, reallocate our buffers. */
00271     if (m_ProbeSize > m_MaxProbeSize) {
00272         Verbose::out(2, 
00273                      "SparseMart::setProbes() - Current probes: " + 
00274                      ToStr(m_ProbeSize) + " is greater than allocated: " + 
00275                      ToStr(m_MaxProbeSize) + " doing reallocation.");
00276         reserve(m_ProbeSize, m_Data.size());
00277     }
00278     /* Always fill with 0's for sanity and debugging. */
00279     for (i = 0; i < m_Data.size(); i++) {
00280                 float zero = 0.0;
00281         fill(m_Data[i].begin(), m_Data[i].end(), zero);
00282     }
00283 }
00284 
00285 /**
00286  * @brief Return all of the intensities for given chipIx
00287  * @param dataSetIx - Chip Index number.
00288  * @return celOrderedData - vector of all intensities in the SparseMart for
00289  * given dataSetIx in CEL order.
00290  */
00291 std::vector<float> SparseMart::getCelData(int dataSetIx) {
00292     assert(dataSetIx < m_Data.size() && dataSetIx >= 0);
00293     std::vector<float> celOrderedData(m_Data[dataSetIx].size());
00294     for (int i = 0; i < m_Map.size(); i++) {
00295         celOrderedData[i] = m_Data[dataSetIx][m_Map[i]];
00296     }
00297     return celOrderedData;
00298 }
00299 
00300 
00301 std::vector<float> SparseMart::getCelData(chipid_t celIx, unsigned int channelIx) {
00302   int dataSetIx = 0;
00303   // convert celname index to cache index, if a mapping exists
00304   if (m_ChipChannelToCacheMap.empty()) {
00305     if (channelIx == 0) {
00306       dataSetIx = celIx;
00307     }
00308     else {
00309       Err::errAbort("\nSparseMart::getCelData - Accessing CEL data with multi-channel index when no multi-channel data is available.");
00310     }
00311   }
00312   else {
00313     assert(celIx >= 0 && celIx < m_ChipChannelToCacheMap.size());
00314     assert(channelIx >= 0 && channelIx < m_ChipChannelToCacheMap[celIx].size());
00315     dataSetIx = m_ChipChannelToCacheMap[celIx][channelIx];
00316   }
00317   std::vector<float> data = getCelData(dataSetIx);
00318   return data;
00319 }

00322 /**
00323  * Is a particular probe's data in the sparsemart?
00324  * @param probeIx - index of probe.
00325  * @return - true if data is contained false otherwise.
00326  */
00327 bool SparseMart::isProbeAvailable(probeid_t probeIx) const {
00328     assert(probeIx < m_Map.size() && probeIx >= 0);
00329     return m_Map[probeIx] >= 0;
00330 }
